citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
A report was not prepared and submitted to the Institutional Official (IO) of the semi-annual evaluations that were
conducted on July 5-6, 2023. Failure to submit reports of semi-annual evaluations can result in the Institutional Official not
being adequately informed of issues in the program or facility. The research facility must prepare reports every 6 months
upon completion of semiannual evaluations that includes a list of deficiencies, distinguish significant from minor
deficiencies, a plan and schedule with dates for correcting each deficiency, and is signed by a majority of IACUC
members and includes any minority views. Correct by ensuring full compliance with all of the requirements in this
subsection.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
During the inspection, all of the active teaching protocols did not include a rationale for involving animals and for the
appropriateness of the number of animals to be used. The protocols did not include a rationale for why animals had to be
used. The protocols did not include a rationale for the number of animals to be used, such as the number of students that
would be involved or the desired student-to-animal ratio. An animal use proposal must include a rationale for involving
animals and the appropriateness of the numbers of animals to be used so that the IACUC can conduct a thorough review
of the components of the activities related to the care and use of animals and determine that the proposed activities are in
accordance with the Animal Welfare Act. Correct by ensuring that all protocols contain all components listed in this
subsection. Correct by 22-Sept-2023.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
A teaching protocol does not have a complete description of the proposed use of animals. Protocol VET211 involves
teaching students how to administer injections. The protocol does not completely describe the procedure, such as which
veins will be used and what gauge of needles to be used. Incomplete descriptions of procedures do not allow the IACUC
to fully understand and review the proposed activities involving animal use. A proposal must contain a complete
description of the proposed use of the animals. Correct by ensuring that all protocols contain all components listed in this
subsection. Correct by 22-Sept-2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a Facility Representative.
